message.content: This question requires knowledge about the principles of thermodynamics. When a turkey thermometer is inserted into the turkey and the turkey is cooked in an oven, the heat causes the air inside the thermometer to expand. As the air expands, it creates pressure, which pushes the plunger cap off. This is why option (B) is correct. Option (A) is incorrect because cold uranium ore has no direct relationship to the expansion of air in a turkey thermometer. Option (C) is incorrect because lead does not expand in the same way as air when heated. Option (D) is incorrect because gas generally expands when heated, not contracts.

This question requires knowledge about the science of temperature and expansion. When a turkey thermometer is inserted into the turkey and heated, the air inside the thermometer plunger starts to expand. As the air expands, it exerts pressure on the cap of the plunger, causing it to come off. Option (A) is incorrect because cold uranium ore does not cause the expansion of air. Option (C) is incorrect because lead does not expand as much as air when heated. Option (D) is incorrect because gas does not contract in this scenario, but instead the air inside the thermometer expands.
